title: Matchsafe, ""Souvenir of A Midsummer Night's Dream"", 1905–06
markings: G&S Co, LTD (in 3-lobed impression), lion passant, G&S Co, LTD (in 3-lobed impression), lion passant, leopard's head, date letter "K" all stamped on bezel.
provenance: Collection of Carol B. Brener and Stephen W. Brener
creditline: Gift of Stephen W. Brener and Carol B. Brener
description: Small, rectangular, featuring raised decoration of man on left, in donkey's head and toga-like costume, on right, reaching out towards him, is woman in long dress, inscribed above "Souvenir of a Midsummer Nights's Dream"; reverse inscribed "Adelphi Theatre, 1906,  "With Otho Stuart's Compliments." Thumb catch at front of lid, lid hinged on opposite side. Link attached below hinge. Striker in recessed groove on bottom.

tombstone.epitaph:
Matchsafe, ""Souvenir of A Midsummer Night's Dream"", 1905–06.
1905–06. Silver. Gift of Stephen W. Brener and Carol B. Brener. 1980-14-279.
